Total Time: 25 minutes
 
 Category: Dinner
 
 Serving Size: 4
 
 Ingredients:
 1 large egg
 2 tbsp. cornstarch
 1 pinch salt and pepper
 1 lb. boneless skinless chicken thighs
 2 tbsp. cooking oil
 1 1/2 cup sesame ginger sauce 
 4 cups cooked jasmine rice
 1 tbsp. sesame seeds
 

Instructions:
 1. In a large bowl, whisk together the egg, cornstarch, and salt and pepper. Trim the chicken thighs and cut them into pieces. Toss the chicken in the egg and cornstarch mixture.
 
 2. Cook oil over medium heat. Add the batter coated chicken and spread it out into the skillet. 
 3. Cook chicken until brown on both sides.
 4. Pour the sesame ginger sauce over top and toss. Simmer sauce until thickened, then turn off the heat.
 5. Serve the chicken over rice. Enjoy!
